instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image and no backlight
threads.message:
Got a bit of an issue with this board, no known liquid damage but had a damaged J8300 and have replaced. Noticed <CAPACITOR>C8325</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8324</CAPACITOR> were removed from the board so replaced those - but now I'm getting no image and no backlight.

I've measured the following which should help.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR>:
2- 3.3v
3- 8v
4, 5 and 6 - 0v

From this have noticed pin 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> is linked with <RESISTOR>R1430</RESISTOR>, checked resistance and got 99.8K. Is pin 5 meant to be the same as pin 2 to open the gate?

<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>
Pin 3 and 4 - 8.2v
All other pins are 0v

Diode mode of L7701 shows 390 on either side, <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> shows 390 on pin 1 and 590 on pin 2.

Any assistance on this would be much appreciated.

Edit: I know this screen is a good working screen as I've been using it on multiple boards for testing and it displays fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image and no backlight
threads.message:
You said no image AND no backlight.
Image MUST appear first; why did you fix on backlight?

"4, [B][U]5[/U][/B] and 6 - 0v"
You cannot expect backlight when missing <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>.

Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image and no backlight
threads.message:
If I remember correctly, I did check to see if there was USB activity and I think there was. I can't check until Monday now though, and yeah I understand pin 5 being 0v shows there is no backlight and thats why I checked with <RESISTOR>R1430</RESISTOR> to see if that was damaged in any way. If I'm looking at the schematics correctly, <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> gets created by the CPU/PCH? 

How would I go ahead and test the image related issues as I'm not getting any image even from shining a torch behind the apple logo on the lid, nothing at all. CPU gets hot to the touch with heatsink off and pulls roughly 0.8A making me think it's booting up.

But as stated I can definitely confirm this isn't a bad screen as it works on every board I've got working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image and no backlight
threads.message:
Pins 18/19 of J8300 MUST get 3V, at least in the first few seconds (when chime).
This voltage is not maintained, if pin 14 doesn't go high in the same time.
